claim.body: uplink transmit power control, comprising: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 1. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: the transmit power control comprises adjusting transmit power spectral density.
claim.claim-text: 2. The method of claim 1 , wherein performing the transmit power control comprises adjusting transmit power spectral density.

claim.body: the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.
claim.claim-text: 3. The method of claim 1 , wherein the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

claim.body: the overload indication as a bit carried by the PBCH.
claim.claim-text: 4. The method of claim 1 , further comprising detecting the overload indication as a bit carried by the PBCH.

claim.body: the overload indication at an access terminal.
claim.claim-text: 5. The method of claim 1 , wherein receiving comprises receiving the overload indication at an access terminal.

claim.body: the overload indication at a small base node comprising a selected one of a femto access point, a home base node, and a closed subscription cell.
claim.claim-text: 6. The method of claim 1 , wherein receiving comprises receiving the overload indication at a small base node comprising a selected one of a femto access point, a home base node, and a closed subscription cell.

claim.body: an access terminal in a coverage area of the small base node to adjust transmit power spectral density based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 7. The method of claim 5 , wherein performing comprises instructing an access terminal in a coverage area of the small base node to adjust transmit power spectral density based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: uplink transmit power control, comprising: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node, detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node; masking a PBCH Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) based on the overload indication; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 8. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node, detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node; masking a PBCH Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) based on the overload indication; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: uplink transmit power control, comprising: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node as a bit per subband carried by the PBCH; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 10. A method of performing uplink transmit power control, comprising: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node as a bit per subband carried by the PBCH; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: the PHICH resources on the PHICH that are orthogonal across a plurality of neighboring nodes for achieving a defined signal-to-noise ratio penetration.
claim.claim-text: 12. The method of claim 11 , further comprising receiving the PHICH resources on the PHICH that are orthogonal across a plurality of neighboring nodes for achieving a defined signal-to-noise ratio penetration.

claim.body: a plurality of the PHICH resources to detect the overload indication.
claim.claim-text: 13. The method of claim 11 , further comprising combining a plurality of the PHICH resources to detect the overload indication.

claim.body: a center portion of bandwidth used by the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 14. The method of claim 11 , further comprising receiving a center portion of bandwidth used by the neighboring node.

claim.body: the overload indication as a Walsh code that is a function of a cell identifier for the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 15. The method of claim 11 , further comprising detecting the overload indication as a Walsh code that is a function of a cell identifier for the neighboring node.

claim.body: the PHICH is time division multiplexed (TDM) modulated in a different time slot from a plurality of neighboring nodes.
claim.claim-text: 16. The method of claim 11 , wherein the PHICH is time division multiplexed (TDM) modulated in a different time slot from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body: the PHICH is frequency division multiplexed (FDM) modulated in a different frequency resource from a plurality of neighboring nodes.
claim.claim-text: 17. The method of claim 11 , wherein the PHICH is frequency division multiplexed (FDM) modulated in a different frequency resource from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body: the PHICH is code division multiplexed (CDM) modulated in a different Walsh code from a plurality of neighboring nodes.
claim.claim-text: 18. The method of claim 11 , wherein the PHICH is code division multiplexed (CDM) modulated in a different Walsh code from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body: the PHICH by receiving a plurality of PHICH resources assigned to the overload indication; and combining log likelihood ratios for the plurality of PHICH resources prior to detecting the overload indication.
claim.claim-text: 19. The method of claim 11 , further comprising: receiving the PHICH by receiving a plurality of PHICH resources assigned to the overload indication; and combining log likelihood ratios for the plurality of PHICH resources prior to detecting the overload indication.

claim.body: the PHICH by decoding with interference cancellation.
claim.claim-text: 20. The method of claim 11 , further comprising receiving the PHICH by decoding with interference cancellation.

claim.body: comprising: a non-transitory computer-readable medium having code for: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 21. A computer program product, comprising: a non-transitory computer-readable medium having code for: receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: the computer-readable medium further has code for adjusting transmit power spectral density.
claim.claim-text: 22. The computer program product of claim 21 , wherein the computer-readable medium further has code for adjusting transmit power spectral density.

claim.body: the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.
claim.claim-text: 23. The computer program product of claim 21 , wherein the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

claim.body: uplink transmit power control, comprising: at least one processor configured to: receive an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detect the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and perform transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 25. An apparatus for performing uplink transmit power control, comprising: at least one processor configured to: receive an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; detect the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and perform transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: the at least one processor performs the transmit power control by adjusting transmit power spectral density.

claim.body: the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.
claim.claim-text: 27. The apparatus of claim 25 , wherein the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

claim.body: uplink transmit power control, comprising: means for receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; means for detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and means for performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.
claim.claim-text: 29. An apparatus for performing uplink transmit power control, comprising: means for receiving an over-the-air broadcast of an overload indication from a neighboring node; means for detecting the overload indication received on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) from the neighboring node, wherein the receiving comprises receiving two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH; and means for performing transmit power control based upon the received overload indication to reduce an interference level at the neighboring node.

claim.body: means for adjusting transmit power spectral density.
claim.claim-text: 30. The apparatus of claim 29 , further comprising means for adjusting transmit power spectral density.

claim.body: the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.
claim.claim-text: 31. The apparatus of claim 29 , wherein the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

claim.body: an overload indication, comprising: determining that an interference level on an uplink exceeds a threshold; and transmitting an over-the-air broadcast of the overload indication on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) for a neighboring recipient to perform transmit power control based upon the overload indication, wherein the transmitting comprises transmitting two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH.
claim.claim-text: 33. A method for broadcasting an overload indication, comprising: determining that an interference level on an uplink exceeds a threshold; and transmitting an over-the-air broadcast of the overload indication on a physical broadcast channel (PBCH) for a neighboring recipient to perform transmit power control based upon the overload indication, wherein the transmitting comprises transmitting two resource blocks within a center of six resource blocks in a midamble of a shortened PBCH.

claim.body: the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.
claim.claim-text: 34. The method of claim 33 , wherein the interference level comprises Interference over Thermal (IoT) noise.

claim.body: further comprising transmitting the overload indication as a bit carried by the PBCH.
claim.claim-text: 35. The method of claim 33 , further comprising transmitting the overload indication as a bit carried by the PBCH.

claim.body: an overload indication, comprising: determining that an interference level on an uplink exceeds a threshold; and transmitting an over-the-air broadcast of the overload indication on a physical hybrid automatic repeat request indicator channel (PHICH) for a neighboring recipient to perform transmit power control based upon the overload indication, wherein the transmitting comprises transmitting PHICH resources on the PHICH that are orthogonal across a plurality of neighboring nodes for achieving a defined signal-to-noise ratio penetration.
claim.claim-text: 36. A method for broadcasting an overload indication, comprising: determining that an interference level on an uplink exceeds a threshold; and transmitting an over-the-air broadcast of the overload indication on a physical hybrid automatic repeat request indicator channel (PHICH) for a neighboring recipient to perform transmit power control based upon the overload indication, wherein the transmitting comprises transmitting PHICH resources on the PHICH that are orthogonal across a plurality of neighboring nodes for achieving a defined signal-to-noise ratio penetration.

claim.body: the PHICH is code division multiplexed (CDM) modulated in a different Walsh code from a plurality of neighboring nodes.
claim.claim-text: 38. The method of claim 36 , wherein the PHICH is code division multiplexed (CDM) modulated in a different Walsh code from a plurality of neighboring nodes.

claim.body: an overload indication, comprising: determining that an interference level on an uplink exceeds a threshold; transmitting an over-the-air broadcast of the overload indication on a physical hybrid automatic repeat request indicator channel (PHICH) for a neighboring recipient to perform transmit power control based upon the overload indication; and distributing the overload indication across a plurality of PHICH resources on the PHICH.
